page.title: 07East Town Hamlet cont.
page.content:
post box, public telephone or bus service,the community has to be very self sufficient, particulary in winter when it is liable to be cut off by snow drifts. One resident told us that she went shopping in Trowbridge once a week for the family provisions. However the isolation of the hamlet was quoted as a bonus by the residents we spoke to. People said that they liked the "peace", that it was a "retreat", "a completely rural situation, yet only 5 miles from Trowbridge".
My friend lives at East Town Farm and I go up there to play.We play Hide and Seek and we make dens in the hay. In the barn we make ramps to jump off, and we play follow the leader on bikes. Nikolas Farley age 11.
